newsitem.title: HUNGARY: COFINEC PLANS NO DIVIDEND ON 1996.
newsitem.headline: COFINEC PLANS NO DIVIDEND ON 1996.

text.p: The management of packaging company Cofinec S.A. said it will propose not pay any dividend to its shareholders on the loss-making year of 1996.
The company did not pay dividend in the past three years, it said in a statement.
Cofinec, a French-registered but Budapest-traded company, will hold its annual shareholders meeting on April 25 in Paris.
In 1996 the company posted a loss of 44.5 million French francs, calculated according to French GAAP accounting standards.
The company's results in 1996, calculated according to International Accounting Standards, showed a consolidated loss of 64.1 million French francs on sales of 664.8 million francs.
On the Budapest Stock Exchange Cofinec traded with Global Depositary Receipts which closed at 5,300 forints on March 21, the last they when they traded.
